An ambulance was called to Ferguson's home in Cheshire on Saturday morning, and the Scotsman was then rushed to hospital. We now know he suffered a subarachnoid brain haemorrhage.

He was quickly taken to Macclesfield District Hospital, but was subsequently transferred, with a police escort, to be treated at the Salford Royal.

While there, he underwent life-saving surgery and now remains in intensive care after yesterday afternoon's procedure.

By all accounts, the surgery went well, and everyone's thoughts and prayers are with his family. We will, of course, bring you all the latest as we get it this morning.
